title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: D. R. Brower to J. J. DeLamater, May 27, 1868
summary: Brower requests that Edward Brooks be discharged from the hospital so "that the government may be relieved of the expense of his support." Jordan investigates the possibility that Brooks' son, living near Staunton, is willing and able to support him.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Health/Illness, Family, American Civil War
